009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2020/12/29
018 */
019public class GaussianKernel2D extends Kernel2D {
020        
021        public GaussianKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY) {
022                super(makeGaussKernel2D(sigmaX, sigmaY));
023        }
024        
025        public GaussianKernel2D(double sigma) {
026                super(makeGaussKernel2D(sigma, sigma));
027        }
028
029        /**
030         * Creates and returns a 2D Gaussian filter kernel large enough
031         * to avoid truncation effects. The associated array is odd-sized in
032         * both dimensions.
033         * The returned kernel is normalized.
034         * 
035         * @param sigmaX the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in x-direction
036         * @param sigmaY the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in y-direction
037         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
038         */
039        public static float[][] makeGaussKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY){
040                final int radX = (int) Math.ceil(GaussianKernel1D.SIZE_FACTOR * sigmaX);
041                final int radY = (int) Math.ceil(GaussianKernel1D.SIZE_FACTOR * sigmaY);
042                final int sizeX = radX + radX + 1;
043                final int sizeY = radY + radY + 1;
044
045                final float[][] kernel = new float[sizeX][sizeY]; //center cell = kernel[rad][rad]
046                final double sigmaX2 = (sigmaX > 0.1) ? sqr(sigmaX) : 0.1;
047                final double sigmaY2 = (sigmaY > 0.1) ? sqr(sigmaY) : 0.1;
048                
049                for (int i = 0; i < sizeY; i++) {
050                        final double  b = sqr(radY - i) / (2 * sigmaY2);
051                        for (int j = 0; j < sizeX; j++) {
052                                final double a = sqr(radX - j) / (2 * sigmaX2);
053                                double g = Math.exp(-(a + b));
054                                kernel[i][j] = (float) g;
055                        }
056                }
057                return normalize(kernel);       // we normalize just in case
058        }
059}
